meanings.definition: To disperse or break up into colloidal particles
meanings.sent1: She peptizes the mixture to make it spread evenly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist peptizes the solution to create a uniform suspension.
meanings.sent3: The chef peptizes the ingredients to ensure a smooth texture in the dish.
meanings.sent4: His calming voice peptizes the tension in the room, creating a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze peptizes the fog, revealing a clear view of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To cause a colloid to become stable by breaking up aggregates of particles
meanings.sent1: The additive peptizes the mixture, preventing clumping.
meanings.sent2: By stirring slowly, you can peptize the solution and avoid sedimentation.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seems to peptize the scattered cards into a perfect deck.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter peptizes the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight peptizes the shadows, revealing hidden details in the painting.
